intro: Anoda strictiflora, commonly known as the upright false flax, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Anoda strictiflora is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry fields.
